verses.kjv: Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he gat no heat.
verses.web: Now king David was old and advanced in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he couldn’t keep warm.
verses.ct: King David was now very old, and no matter how many blankets they piled on him, he couldn't get warm.

verses.kjv: Wherefore his servants said unto him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand before the king, and let her cherish him, and let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord the king may get heat.
verses.web: Therefore his servants said to him, “Let a young virgin be sought for my lord the king. Let her stand before the king, and cherish him; and let her lie in your bosom, that my lord the king may keep warm.”
verses.ct: So his servants suggested, "Let us find a young virgin for my lord the king. She can attend to you, lie close to you, and keep you warm."

verses.kjv: So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the coasts of Israel, and found Abishag a Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
verses.web: So they sought for a beautiful young lady throughout all the borders of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
verses.ct: They searched throughout all of Israel for a beautiful young woman and found Abishag the Shunammite. They brought her to the king.

verses.kjv: And the damsel was very fair, and cherished the king, and ministered to him: but the king knew her not.
verses.web: The young lady was very beautiful; and she cherished the king, and served him; but the king didn’t know her intimately.
verses.ct: She was very beautiful. She took care of the king and waited on him, but the king never slept with her.

verses.kjv: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.web: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, “I will be king.” Then he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Adonijah son of Haggith began promoting himself, declaring, "I will be king!" He got himself chariots, horsemen, and 50 men to run ahead of him.

verses.kjv: And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why hast thou done so? and he also was a very goodly man; and his mother bare him after Absalom.
verses.web: His father had not displeased him at any time in saying, “Why have you done so?” and he was also a very handsome man; and he was born after Absalom.
verses.ct: His father had never challenged him at any point by asking, "Why are you doing this?" Adonijah was also very handsome, and he was born next after Absalom.

verses.kjv: And he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah helped him.
verses.web: He conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest; and they followed Adonijah and helped him.
verses.ct: He conspired with Joab son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the priest, and they threw their support behind him.

verses.kjv: But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men which belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.
verses.web: But Zadok the priest, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and the mighty men who belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.
verses.ct: But Zadok the priest, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and David's elite warriors did not side with Adonijah.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattle by the stone of Zoheleth, which is by Enrogel, and called all his brethren the king’s sons, and all the men of Judah the king’s servants:
verses.web: Adonijah killed sheep, cattle, and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En Rogel; and he called all his brothers, the king’s sons, and all the men of Judah, the king’s servants;
verses.ct: Adonijah sacrificed sheep, cattle, and fattened calves at the stone of Zoheleth near En-rogel. He invited all his brothers — the king's sons — and all the royal officials from Judah.

verses.kjv: But Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he called not.
verses.web: but he didn’t call Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother.
verses.ct: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the elite warriors, or his brother Solomon.

verses.kjv: Wherefore Nathan spake unto Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, Hast thou not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith doth reign, and David our lord knoweth it not?
verses.web: Then Nathan spoke to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, “Haven’t you heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith reigns, and David our lord doesn’t know it?
verses.ct: Nathan went to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother, and asked, "Have you heard that Adonijah son of Haggith has made himself king? And David our lord doesn't even know about it!"

verses.kjv: Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and the life of thy son Solomon.
verses.web: Now therefore come, please let me give you counsel, that you may save your own life, and your son Solomon’s life.
verses.ct: "Listen, let me give you some advice that could save your life and the life of your son Solomon."

verses.kjv: Go and get thee in unto king David, and say unto him, Didst not thou, my lord, O king, swear unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign?
verses.web: Go in to king David, and tell him, ‘Didn’t you, my lord, king, swear to your servant, saying, “Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?” Why then does Adonijah reign?’
verses.ct: "Go to King David and say to him, 'My lord the king, didn't you swear an oath to me, your servant, saying, "Your son Solomon will be king after me and will sit on my throne"? Then why has Adonijah become king?'"

verses.kjv: Behold, while thou yet talkest there with the king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words.
verses.web: Behold, while you are still talking there with the king, I will also come in after you and confirm your words.”
verses.ct: "While you're still speaking with the king, I'll come in behind you and back up everything you've said."

verses.kjv: And Bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite ministered unto the king.
verses.web: Bathsheba went in to the king in his room. The king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite was serving the king.
verses.ct: So Bathsheba went to the king in his private room. The king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was attending to him.

verses.kjv: And Bathsheba bowed, and did obeisance unto the king. And the king said, What wouldest thou?
verses.web: Bathsheba bowed, and showed respect to the king. The king said, “What would you like?”
verses.ct: Bathsheba bowed low before the king. He asked, "What do you want?"

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, My lord, thou swarest by the LORD thy God unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne.
verses.web: She said to him, “My lord, you swore by LORD your God to your servant, ‘Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne.’
verses.ct: She said, "My lord, you swore to your servant by the LORD your God, 'Your son Solomon will reign after me and sit on my throne.'

verses.kjv: And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and now, my lord the king, thou knowest it not:
verses.web: Now, behold, Adonijah reigns; and you, my lord the king, don’t know it.
verses.ct: But now Adonijah has made himself king, and you, my lord the king, don't even know about it!

verses.kjv: And he hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the host: but Solomon thy servant hath he not called.
verses.web: He has slain cattle and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the sons of the king, Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the army; but he hasn’t called Solomon your servant.
verses.ct: He has sacrificed large numbers of cattle, fattened calves, and sheep. He has invited all the king's sons, along with Abiathar the priest and Joab the army commander — but he did not invite your servant Solomon.

verses.kjv: And thou, my lord, O king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
verses.web: You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who will sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
verses.ct: My lord the king, all of Israel is watching you, waiting for you to announce who will sit on your throne after you.

verses.kjv: Otherwise it shall come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders.
verses.web: Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king sleeps with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon will be considered criminals.”
verses.ct: If you don't act, then when you die, my son Solomon and I will be treated as criminals."

verses.kjv: And, lo, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet also came in.
verses.web: Behold, while she was still talking with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.
verses.ct: While she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet arrived.

verses.kjv: And they told the king, saying, Behold Nathan the prophet. And when he was come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
verses.web: They told the king, saying, “Behold, Nathan the prophet!” When he had come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
verses.ct: They announced to the king, "Nathan the prophet is here." Nathan came before the king and bowed with his face to the ground.

verses.kjv: And Nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?
verses.web: Nathan said, “My lord, king, have you said, ‘Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?’
verses.ct: Nathan said, "My lord the king, did you declare that Adonijah would reign after you and sit on your throne?

verses.kjv: For he is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the king’s sons, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priest; and, behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, God save king Adonijah.
verses.web: For he has gone down today, and has slain cattle, fatlings, and sheep in abundance, and has called all the king’s sons, the captains of the army, and Abiathar the priest. Behold, they are eating and drinking before him, and saying, ‘Long live king Adonijah!’
verses.ct: Because today he went down and sacrificed large numbers of cattle, fattened calves, and sheep. He invited all the king's sons, the army commanders, and Abiathar the priest. Right now they are eating and drinking with him and shouting, 'Long live King Adonijah!'

verses.kjv: But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon, hath he not called.
verses.web: But he hasn’t called me, even me your servant, Zadok the priest, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon.
verses.ct: But he did not invite me — your servant — or Zadok the priest, or Benaiah son of Jehoiada, or your servant Solomon.

verses.kjv: Is this thing done by my lord the king, and thou hast not shewed it unto thy servant, who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?
verses.web: Was this thing done by my lord the king, and you haven’t shown to your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?”
verses.ct: Did my lord the king authorize this without telling your servants who should sit on the throne after you?"

verses.kjv: Then king David answered and said, Call me Bathsheba. And she came into the king’s presence, and stood before the king.
verses.web: Then king David answered, “Call Bathsheba in to me.” She came into the king’s presence and stood before the king.
verses.ct: King David responded, "Bring Bathsheba back to me." She came in and stood before the king.

verses.kjv: And the king sware, and said, As the LORD liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress,
verses.web: The king swore, and said, “As LORD lives, who has redeemed my soul out of all adversity,
verses.ct: The king swore an oath: "As surely as the LORD lives — the one who has rescued me from every trouble —

verses.kjv: Even as I sware unto thee by the LORD God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so will I certainly do this day.
verses.web: most certainly as I swore to you by LORD, the God of Israel, saying, ‘Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place;’ I will most certainly do this today.”
verses.ct: I will carry out today what I swore to you by the LORD, the God of Israel: your son Solomon will reign after me and will sit on my throne in my place."

verses.kjv: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and did reverence to the king, and said, Let my lord king David live for ever.
verses.web: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and showed respect to the king, and said, “Let my lord king David live forever!”
verses.ct: Bathsheba bowed with her face to the ground and said, "May my lord King David live forever!"

verses.kjv: And king David said, Call me Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.
verses.web: King David said, “Call to me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada.” They came before the king.
verses.ct: Then King David said, "Summon Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada." They came before the king.

verses.kjv: The king also said unto them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule, and bring him down to Gihon:
verses.web: The king said to them, “Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride on my own mule, and bring him down to Gihon.
verses.ct: The king told them, "Take my officials with you, put my son Solomon on my own mule, and escort him down to Gihon.

verses.kjv: And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel: and blow ye with the trumpet, and say, God save king Solomon.
verses.web: Let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel. Blow the trumpet, and say, ‘Long live king Solomon!’
verses.ct: There, Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet are to anoint him king over Israel. Then blow the trumpet and shout, 'Long live King Solomon!'

verses.kjv: Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.
verses.web: Then come up after him, and he shall come and sit on my throne; for he shall be king in my place. I have appointed him to be prince over Israel and over Judah.”
verses.ct: After that, follow him back here so he can take his seat on my throne. He will be king in my place — I have appointed him ruler over all Israel and Judah."

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, Amen: the LORD God of my lord the king say so too.
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, “Amen. May LORD, the God of my lord the king, say so.
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada replied, "Amen! May the LORD, the God of my lord the king, confirm it!

verses.kjv: As the LORD hath been with my lord the king, even so be he with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.
verses.web: As LORD has been with my lord the king, even so may he be with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.”
verses.ct: Just as the LORD has been with my lord the king, may he be with Solomon, and may he make Solomon's throne even greater than the throne of my lord King David."

verses.kjv: So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon king David’s mule, and brought him to Gihon.
verses.web: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites went down and had Solomon ride on king David’s mule, and brought him to Gihon.
verses.ct: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and Pelethites went down, put Solomon on King David's mule, and brought him to Gihon.

verses.kjv: And Zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacle, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, God save king Solomon.
verses.web: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil from the Tent, and anointed Solomon. They blew the trumpet; and all the people said, “Long live king Solomon!”
verses.ct: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. They blew the trumpet, and all the people shouted, "Long live King Solomon!"

verses.kjv: And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.
verses.web: All the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth shook with their sound.
verses.ct: The whole crowd followed him back, playing flutes and celebrating with such tremendous joy that the ground shook from the noise.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah and all the guests that were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, Wherefore is this noise of the city being in an uproar?
verses.web: Adonijah and all the guests who were with him heard it as they had finished eating. When Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, “Why is this noise of the city being in an uproar?”
verses.ct: Adonijah and all his guests heard the commotion just as they were finishing their feast. When Joab heard the trumpet blast, he asked, "What's all that uproar in the city?"

verses.kjv: And while he yet spake, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came; and Adonijah said unto him, Come in; for thou art a valiant man, and bringest good tidings.
verses.web: While he yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came; and Adonijah said, “Come in; for you are a worthy man, and bring good news.”
verses.ct: While he was still speaking, Jonathan son of Abiathar the priest arrived. Adonijah said, "Come in! You're a good man — you must be bringing good news."

verses.kjv: And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king.
verses.web: Jonathan answered Adonijah, “Most certainly our lord king David has made Solomon king.
verses.ct: "Not at all," Jonathan answered. "Our lord King David has made Solomon king!

verses.kjv: And the king hath sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and they have caused him to ride upon the king’s mule:
verses.web: The king has sent with him Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and they have caused him to ride on the king’s mule.
verses.ct: The king sent Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and Pelethites with him. They put Solomon on the king's own mule.

verses.kjv: And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon: and they are come up from thence rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that ye have heard.
verses.web: Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon. They have come up from there rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that you have heard.
verses.ct: Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anointed him king at Gihon. They came back from there celebrating, and the whole city is buzzing with it. That's the noise you've been hearing.

verses.kjv: And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.
verses.web: Also, Solomon sits on the throne of the kingdom.
verses.ct: What's more, Solomon is already sitting on the royal throne.

verses.kjv: And moreover the king’s servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, God make the name of Solomon better than thy name, and make his throne greater than thy throne. And the king bowed himself upon the bed.
verses.web: Moreover the king’s servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, ‘May your God make the name of Solomon better than your name, and make his throne greater than your throne;’ and the king bowed himself on the bed.
verses.ct: The king's officials even came to congratulate our lord King David, saying, 'May your God make Solomon's name even greater than yours and his throne even greater than yours!' And the king bowed in worship right there on his bed.

verses.kjv: And also thus said the king, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, which hath given one to sit on my throne this day, mine eyes even seeing it.
verses.web: Also thus said the king, ‘Blessed be LORD, the God of Israel, who has given one to sit on my throne today, my eyes even seeing it.’ ”
verses.ct: The king himself said, 'Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who has given me a successor to sit on my throne today — and let me live to see it.'"

verses.kjv: And all the guests that were with Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way.
verses.web: All the guests of Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and each man went his way.
verses.ct: At this, all of Adonijah's guests panicked. They got up and scattered, each going his own way.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah feared because of Solomon, and arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
verses.web: Adonijah was afraid because of Solomon; and he arose, and went, and hung onto the horns of the altar.
verses.ct: Adonijah himself was terrified of Solomon. He rushed to the tabernacle and grabbed hold of the horns of the altar.

verses.kjv: And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah feareth king Solomon: for, lo, he hath caught hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay his servant with the sword.
verses.web: Solomon was told, “Behold, Adonijah fears king Solomon; for, behold, he is hanging onto the horns of the altar, saying, ‘Let king Solomon swear to me first that he will not kill his servant with the sword.’ ”
verses.ct: Word reached Solomon: "Adonijah is afraid of King Solomon. He's clinging to the horns of the altar and saying, 'Let King Solomon swear to me today that he won't execute his servant with the sword.'"

verses.kjv: And Solomon said, If he will shew himself a worthy man, there shall not an hair of him fall to the earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die.
verses.web: Solomon said, “If he shows himself a worthy man, not a hair of his shall fall to the earth; but if wickedness is found in him, he shall die.”
verses.ct: Solomon replied, "If he proves himself to be an honorable man, not a hair on his head will be touched. But if any wickedness is found in him, he will die."

verses.kjv: So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and bowed himself to king Solomon: and Solomon said unto him, Go to thine house.
verses.web: So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. He came and bowed down to king Solomon; and Solomon said to him, “Go to your house.”
verses.ct: So King Solomon sent men to bring Adonijah down from the altar. Adonijah came and bowed before King Solomon, and Solomon told him, "Go home."
